data.title: Europe
data.meta_description: dert (5) - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The Kingdom of Sardinia was a state that existed from 1720 to 1861 that united the island of Sardinia and mainland territories of the House of Savoy. Before 1847, only Sardinia was officially part of the kingdom, while other Savoy possessions like Piedmont were personally held by the royal family. In 1847 the Perfect Fusion united all Savoy lands into a single kingdom with its capital in Turin. By 1861 the kingdom had expanded across the Italian peninsula and changed its name to the Kingdom of Italy, the predecessor of modern Italy.
